episode_title: 517 - The One With Rachel’s Inadvertant Kiss

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there as Rachel enters, happily.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good, you guys are all here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! What’s up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I have a job interview at Ralph Lauren tomorrow!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Congratulations! Ohh, that’s great!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Boy, that guy’s underwear sucks!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh-what?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got this pair marked excess, I gotta tell ya, there was no room for excess anything in there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anyway, I’m going to be the coordinator of the woman’s collection, I’ll work right under the director, it’s the perfect, perfect job for me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Well, if you nail the interview, you’ll get it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You wanna work on your interview skills?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: O-okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! All right, let’s start with the handshake. Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.
(They shake hands.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Very good handshake, good wrist action.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let me try. (Gets up to join them.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (They shake hands and she pulls away suddenly) Oh my God! What did I ever do to you?! (Rubbing her hand.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did I squeeze it too hard?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Let’s just say, I’m glad I’m not Chandler.
(Chandler tries to comprehend that remark.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is standing at the window waving at Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right Ross, I can see you in your new apartment! And you can see me! Same as yesterday, (To Monica) same as the day before.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is he doing his shark attack bit yet?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope. Op, wait! There he goes.
(We see Ross through the window and he acts like a swimmer that gets attacked by a shark, picture one of the many, many, many Jaws movies they made and you get the idea.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Very funny Ross! Very life-like and funny. Okay. (Notices that a woman is waving back.) Oh no-no-no, I wasn’t waving at you lady. (She just stares at him.) (Joey sees how beautiful she is.) Whoa, maybe I was! Hey, Monica, this totally hot girl in Ross’s building is flirting with me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Get in there man! Flirt back, mix it up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I-I-I’m down with that. (He turns back to the woman.) Okay, here goes. (Thinks.) How (Holds up his hand like an Indian) you (Points at her) a-doin’? (Does a little twisting motion with both hands and ends up pointing at her, he then winks. She smiles and waves again.) (To Monica) It worked! She’s waving me over. (Towards the woman.) Okay, I-I-I’ll be right over. Let’s see, she’s on the third floor…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! She is pretty, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Tell me about it, huh? (Realizes that she can see Monica.) Oh no-no-no, I’m not with her, she’s just Monica! (He pantomimes that out.) Ewwuck! (He pushes Monica away and makes a disgusted face.)

content.description: Ross’s Building, Joey is trying to find the hot girl’s apartment. So he’s walking up the hallway counting doors. He comes to what he thinks is the right one and knocks on it. Ross opens the door, it’s his apartment.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Joey! Great stuff huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is your place?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course it is. Yeah, come on in. Ooh-ooh, go by the window you can pretend to be surfing. (He pretends he’s surfing by the window.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But I counted, you’re not supposed to live here! Oh man! (Runs away.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ugh!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I ended up at Ross’s place. Oh, I musta missed counted or something. (Looks out the window.) Damn! She’s not there anymore. Oh, l-l-look, Ross is doing his ‘Watching TV’ bit. (We see Ross sitting on the couch and flipping through the channels on his remote.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No Joey, I think he’s just watchin’ TV.
(It’s only when the camera cuts to Ross’s apartment that we see that the TV is turned off and Ross is indeed doing a bit. He then tries to hide his smirk.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, later that day, Gary is kissing Phoebe good-bye.

content.speaker: Gary’s Radio
content.text: We’ve lost visual contact with the suspect.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay, now I’ve really have to go!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But it’s just so unfair that our date has to get cut short just ’cause some guy shot at a store clerk.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: I know, but it’s my job, sweethart!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, then maybe I can come too!

content.speaker: Gary’s Radio
content.text: Suspect has just emerged naked from the sewer.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, you go. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Bye-bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ’kay, bye!
(Gary closes the door behind him.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh I just miss him so much!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! For just a week you guys are really close, huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s weird. I can’t help it though he’s so sweet, he’s like this little puppy dog, y’know? But like a really tough one that shots bad guys. Ohh, I just love beginning parts of relationships, y’know?! You just like can’t keep your hands off each other.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know it is the best.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So-so how long did that last for you and Chandler?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? It’s still going on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, seriously! When did it end?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I-I am serious, I mean, we’re, we’re all over each other all the time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, you know where you are better than I do. I was just curious.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: (Jumping up) What don’t you just calm down Phoebe! All right?! Why don’t you just get all your facts before you run around telling everybody that you’re the only hot couple!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God, I woke the beast. Sorry. (To Monica) I was wrong obviously, I just—I misspoke. It’s okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no, it is okay, I mean as long as you know that Chandler and I are also very hot and fiery, just as hot as you! I mean our flame, whew, is on fire!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Monica, here’s your broom back.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are so cute. (She goes over and kisses him passionately.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next day, Chandler and Joey are there as Rachel returns from her interview.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hey, how’d the interview go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, horrible! I did the stupidest, most embarrassing thing!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did you tell the guy you wanted to have sex with his wife and then fall right out of your chair?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, it was horrible! And-and the interview part went so well, y’know? I even made him laugh. He said something about a boat and I was like, “Well, yeah! If you’ve got enough life jackets!” (She starts laughing; Chandler and Joey are not amused.) Trust me, it was actually, it was very funny. Anyway, so we were saying good-bye and ugh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, we were shaking hands and he kinda leaned toward me… Y’know maybe he was going to open the door, but I totally miss read him and I uhhh… (The flashback shows that she kissed him on the cheek.)
content.parenthetical: We see a flashback as Rachel describes what happened.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You kissed him?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I didn’t know what else to do!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well you coulda tried, not kissing him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, a guy from Ralph Lauren called, you got a second interview!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe it! I got a second interview!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I bet that kiss isn’t looking like such a big mistake now, is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-what, wait a minute, you don’t think that’s why he wants me back?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! (Chandler makes a noise) No?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A kiss? What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I accidentally kissed him in the interview, and now he wants me back y’know of course, ’cause “Let’s bring the girl back who kisses everybody!”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! What if he thinks I’m the kind of girl that-that would just sleep with him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He probably wants you back because you’re right for the job.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe. I-I don’t know—Oh God, how could I be so stupid?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh Rachel look, don’t say that, I think you just need a hug from Joey. Come on. Come on. (She hugs him and Joey looks out the window.) She’s back! Hot girl’s back!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, well I’m not totally back yet, but thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, in Ross’s building! (He throws Rachel onto the chair and heads to the window.) She’s back! She’s back! (Pantomimes) Okay, wait there, I’ll be over in a second. (He counts where she is again.) Got it! (Runs out and does a little hot over a chair.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I gotta check out this hot girl! (He heads to the window but realizes something, stops, turns and points at Monica.) There she is! (He dances over to her and kisses her.)

content.description: Ross’s building, Joey is knocking on a door again. It’s again answered by Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damnit!! Did you move?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. I lived with you guys for a while and then I found this place. (Joey just stares at him) I’m Ross.
(Joey makes a frustrated face and noise and walks away. He knocks on the next door and it’s answered by an old man.)

content.speaker: The Old Man
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh do you happen to have a hot girl in there?

content.speaker: The Old Man
content.text: No. I’m all alone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Sorry about that. (He walks away and knocks on the next door which is answered by a little girl.) Oh, hey little girl. Uhh, is-is your mommy, or sister, or babysitter by any chance a hot girl?

content.speaker: The Little Girl
content.text: Daddy!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Later! (He runs away down the hall and hides behind a corner to a whole other corridor.) Oh man! (Walks down the hallway in desperation.) Hot girl! Hot girl!!

content.description: Rachel’s job interview, she is waiting outside Mr. Zelner’s (the interviewer) office banging her pen between her teeth.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Hi Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Come on in.
(They go inside.)

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: It’s really nice to see you again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Oh Rachel, uhh… (He points to his lip to get her to notice the ink on hers.)
content.parenthetical: Sees that she has some ink on her lip from her pen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Just ah… (He points again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Here let me… (He goes to wipe it off himself.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh-whoa! All right, okay-okay, I see, I see what’s going on here! Now listen, look-look, I’m sorry if I gave you the wrong impression, but I am not some hussy who will just sleep around to get ahead! Now even though I (He tries to interrupt and tell her about the ink), hey-hey-hey, even though I kissed you, that does not give you the right to demand sex from me. I do not want, this job that bad. Good day, sir. (She storms out of his office.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is returning from her interview attempt.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, you will not believe what that sleaze-ball from Ralph Lauren did too me!
(Joey, Monica, and Ross all point to their lips to get Rachel to once again notice the ink on her lip.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay-okay that-that’s amazing. How did you know that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got ink on your lip.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (Realizes.) Ohhhhhhhhh…

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Gary and Chandler and Monica are all there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what do you say, maybe sometime I hold your gun?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: I don’t know man, we’re really not supposed to do that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, what can happen? I mean, would you… (He gestures and spills some of his coffee.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Yeah, I’m gonna say no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, do you want to go see a movie after dinner tonight?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh we can’t, we already have plans.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, same thing we did all day, hang out at Gary’s apartment. He is so amazing, we never left the bedroom. But have fun at the movie.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, we’re not seeing a movie!
content.parenthetical: That annoying competitiveness thing kicks in again, what the heck is that with her and why must the writers show it every flippin’ episode?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re not? Then why did you ask us if we wanted to go?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh umm, that’s because I just wanted to y’know walk in on me and Chandler while we were, y’know, doing it all night. Will you excuse me for just a second?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (She gets up and walks over to Chandler.) Chandler? Can I see you for a second?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (They walk away to get some privacy.) We have got to beat them! {Here we go yet again.}

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ’Cause, Gary and Phoebe think they’re a hotter couple than we are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh, so?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So! So we’ve got to go upstairs and have a lot of sex to prove them wrong!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica, you have got to stop this competitive thing! Okay? It’s crazy. {Finally! The voice of reason.} I mean, just impress Gary and Phoebe we have to go upstairs and have sex over and over and I’m saying no to this, why? Get your coat.

content.description: The lobby in Ross’s building, we see a flyer that is on the bulletin board that reads, “Are you the Hot Girl who waved at me? If so, give me a call!” and it’s signed, Joey 629-9*** (The last couple of numbers have been ripped off). Anyhoo, Ross is getting his mail.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!
content.parenthetical: to the woman checking her mail next to him

content.text: (A man walks up.)

content.speaker: The Man
content.text: Excuse me. (He puts up a flyer that has a sketch drawing of Joey and it reads, “Warning! Intruder! If you see this creep - call the cops!”) You should check this out, tell the other tenants. Apparently he’s running around looking for some kind of a hot girl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who isn’t?
content.parenthetical: to the woman checking her mail

content.text: (For the first time we see that the woman Ross is talking too is in fact the hot girl that Joey is looking for. She just kinda stares at him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t, I don’t think we’ve meet. I-I’m Ross.

content.speaker: The Hot Girl
content.text: I know. You’re the guy who wouldn’t chip in for the handyman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nevermind! (Goes back to his mailbox.)

content.speaker: The Hot Girl
content.text: No, I-I actually thought it was unfair the way everyone reacted. I mean you had just moved in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I had just moved in. Thank you! Listen umm…

content.speaker: The Hot Girl
content.text: Jen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Jen, I know this may sound a little…(makes some kind of crazy noise) But uh, would you maybe wanna grab a cup of coffee sometime, or…

content.speaker: Jen
content.text: Sure! That would be nice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm?

content.speaker: Jen
content.text: Oh! My number is on there. (Hands him a business card.) Give me a call.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I will give you a call.

content.speaker: Jen
content.text: I’ll see you later. (Starts to walk away.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay!
(After she’s left, Ross gets really happy and starts kissing the card. Suddenly, she returns.)

content.speaker: Jen
content.text: I forgot my paper. (Ross quickly hides the card in his mouth.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, a post-coital Monica and Chandler are recovering on the couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was amazing!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe and Gary are so gonna hear about this at dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was amazing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We are the hottest! Huh? No one is hotter than we are! You’re the best.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you’re the best.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you’re the best.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you’re the best.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am the best.
(Just as they start to get up, Joey walks in.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey guys! (Sees their state of undress) What ‘cha been doin’? (Has a silly grin.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Joey! Isn’t that the girl that waved at you the other day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. But I can see through your sheet. (He looks out the window.) Yeah, yeah, that’s her. But y’know what? Doesn’t matter, I’m never gonna get to meet her anyway.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because it’s impossible to find her apartment! She lives in some like of hot girl parallel universe, or something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about? (Pointing out the window.) She obviously lives on the second floor, seventh apartment from the left!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. No. No. She lives on the third floor, eighth apartment from the left.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, those first two windows, (Points) that’s the lobby. And y’know the other one over there, that’s the stairway. You’ve been counting wrong.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I did not know that! Thank you Monica. (Starts to leave) I can’t believe I almost lost another girl because of counting.

content.description: Jen’s apartment, Ross is picking her up for their date.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uhh, you ready?

content.speaker: Jen
content.text: Sure, I’ll just get my coat. (There’s a knock on the door.) Could you get that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure. (He opens the door to Joey. Needless to say, Joey’s stunned.) Joey…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dahhhhh!! (Ross has a puzzled look on his face.) No! Noooo!! (Storms off.)

content.description: Mr. Zelner’s office, Rachel has come back again to try and do that second interview.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, first, I-I would like to say thank you for agreeing to see me again.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: That’s quite all right, but I feel obligated to tell you that this meeting is being videotaped.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Umm, well, first I would like to start by apologizing for kissing you and uh, for yelling at you.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Fair enough.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now you’re probably going to hire one of the people who did not ah, (She puts her hands on his desk blotter and he moves it. Rachel then doesn’t know where to put her hands.) who did, who did not umm, yell at you and storm out, and I think that’s a big mistake and here’s why. I made a huge fool of myself and I came back, that shows courage. When I thought you wanted sex in exchange for this job, I said no. That shows integrity. And, I was not afraid to stand up for myself and that shows courage. (Suddenly realizes that she said courage twice.) Okay umm, now I know I already said courage, but y’know you gotta have courage. And umm, and finally when I thought you were making sexual advances in the workplace, I said no and I was not litigious. {By the way, litigious means to want to litigate and litigate is to make a lawsuit against. So she didn’t want to sue him. Don’t worry, I had to look it up too.} So there you go, you got, you got (counts them off with her fingers) courage, you got integrity, you got (Pause) courage again, and not litigious. Look Mr…

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Zelner.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Zelner! Right! I knew that! I really, really want this job and I think, I think I would be really good at it.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Y’know what? I may regret this but uh, I’m going to give you a shot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! You are?

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? Oh thank you! Oh… Oh, would it be completely inappropriate to give you a hug?

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well then how about a handshake? (She goes to shake his hand but misses and touches his groin.) Oh God I’m sorry! Oh God, I’m sorry! I did not mean to touch that—I mean you there. There. Uhh, okay, so thank-thank you, I’m going to leave now thank you very much uh-huh, thank you so—Hey! I’ll see you Monday! (Exits.)

content.description: A restaurant, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Gary are on a double date. Chandler is yawning.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You tired Chandler?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You better believe he’s tired, after the day we had! If you know what I mean. You know what I mean?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, the tortilla chips know what you mean.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: So uh Chandler, you like that badge I got you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, it’s so cool. (He opens his coat and has it pinned to the lining.) Now I gotta go, Officer Bing has gotta, 10-100. (Pause, softly) That’s pee-pee. (Heads for the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you have a, a twig in your hair.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, (laughs) umm, we kinda took a little detour on the way over here.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Yeah, we took a little stroll in the park and no one was around, so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You didn’t!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We did! We violated Section 12 Paragraph 7 of the criminal code!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The park huh? A public place.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hear ya. Excuse me for just a second! (Gets up and heads for the bathroom as that annoying Gotta-win-at-all-costs-super-competitive thing kicks in again.)
[Cut to the Men’s room. Chandler is practicing flashing his badge as Monica enters.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica! This is the Men’s room! (Pause) Isn’t it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes it is. You see I’ve always found the men’s bathroom very sexual. Haven’t you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. And if I did, I don’t think we’d be going out. Monica, this is getting ridiculous!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, we can’t let them win!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ugh, we have already proved that we are hot! Okay? So why-why are you getting so obsessed about this thing?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because Phoebe and Gary are in that-can’t-keep-their-hands-off-each-other-doing-it-in-the-park phase!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I feel really sad that we’re not…really there anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh wow! Is that what this all have been about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wasn’t it a lot more exciting when we were y’know all over each other all the time?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah that was great. That was really great! But to tell you the truth, I’m more excited about where we are right now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! I’ve never been in a relationship that’s lasted this long before. Y’know to get past the beginning and still be around each other all the time, I think that’s pretty incredible. And the fact that this is happening all with you, yeah I think that’s pretty exciting. (Kisses her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is so sweet. I know that I was acting a little crazy but umm, I feel the same way.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what I just realized? You just freaked out about our relationship.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did not.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes you did! Admit it! You freaked out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I freaked out a little.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Little?! You freaked out big time! Okay? And I fixed it! We have switched places! I am the relationship and king and you are the crazy, irrational screw up! (Does a dance of joy.) (Monica glares at him.) And now we’re back.

content.description: Looking through Ross’s window, he’s doing more pantomimes. The first one is he’s walking a dog that has stopped, then suddenly tugs him forward.

content.text: [Cut to the inside of Monica and Rachel’s apartment, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I cannot believe Ross is buying this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank God! I can’t watch him anymore!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You guys ready fore the movies?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Oh by the way, thank you for loaning us Pamela and Yasmine.

(We see through the big window from the outside and see that Monica and Rachel have pictures of their faces pasted onto cardboard cutouts of Pamela Anderson and Yasmine Bleeth wearing their Baywatch swimsuits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Man! They cannot get enough! (Makes like he’s a robot and waves at the cutouts.)
